Build and deploy static github pages blog using hugo(hugo-theme-luna)

What is hugo and why hugo Hugo is one of the most popular open-source static site generators. With its amazing speed and flexibility, Hugo makes building websites fun again. For those who knows little about how to build and maintain a web site or those who care nothing but write, hugo is your friend. With hugo, even a normal internet user can build his site. Besides, if you has some programming experience(like command-line and github usage experience), you can build and maintain your site easily and conveniently. Preparation before we start install hugo hugo’s official guide tells you how to install hugo at all platforms. But the most easy way is download releases at hugo github repository . Tips remember add hugo binary file to your environment extended versions are more recommended packer managers(like apt in ubuntu) alwarys download old versions install go and git go and git are hugo Prerequisite Tools. You can easily download them at any platforms. try google “install git at ubuntu” or “install go at windows” build your site Check environment Before our adventure, make sure you have install all dependencies and add them to your environment path. Run commands below, you should get similar output, otherwise, you may do something wrong. build site locally Hugo using command to create local site directory. You can change “myBlog” to any name you like. After run this command, a directory named “myBlog” should occur in your current directory. That is your local site directory. Deploy your site in github install theme https://themes.gohugo.io/ fixed https://gohugo.io/getting-started/quick-start/
